methods.name: Function **FindChannelOfObject**(channelName As String) As Channel
methods.description:
*(Inherited from Base)* Finds an animation channel acting on this object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it returns *null*.
You can limit the search to a particular director by using the syntax "directorName$channelName" for the *channelName* argument. Nested directors may be specified like this: "directorName1$directorName2$channelName".

methods.name: Function **FindKeyframeOfObject**(keyframeName As String) As Keyframe
methods.description:
*(Inherited from Base)* Finds a keyframe acting on the object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it returns *null*.
You can limit the search to a particular director by using the syntax "directorName$keyframeName" for the *keyframeName* argument. Nested directors may be specified like this: "directorName1$directorName2$keyframeName".

methods.name: Function **FindOrCreateChannelOfObject**(channelName As String) As Channel
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* This function works like FindChannelOfObject except that if no animation channel with the specifed name exists, a new one is created.

methods.name: Function **GetChannelsOfObject**([out] v As Array[Channel]) As Integer
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Fills the array *v* with the animation channels acting on this object, returning the number of channels. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), *v* will be empty.

methods.name: Function **IsAnimated**() As Boolean
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Returns true if there are animation channels for this object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it always returns *false*.

methods.name: Sub **SetChanged**()
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Mark this object as changed.

Types.name: Array[Type]
Types.descripton: A dynamic, one-dimensional array. The element type must be specified in brackets. Use the index operator [] to access individual elements. Negative indices refer to elements at the end of the array.

properties.name: **LBound** As Integer *[read-only]*
properties.description: The index of the first elment (always 0)

properties.name: **Size** As Integer
properties.description: The size of the array (this member can be set to change the size)

properties.name: **UBound** As Integer *[read-only]*
properties.description: The index of the last elment (-1 if the array is empty)

methods.name: Sub **Clear**()
methods.description: erases all elements

methods.name: Sub **Erase**(index As Integer)
methods.description: Erases the element at 'index'.

methods.name: Sub **Insert**(index As Integer, element As Type)
methods.description: Inserts a new element at 'index'.

methods.name: Sub **Pop**()
methods.description: removes the last element

methods.name: Sub **Push**(element As Type)
methods.description: Inserts a new element at the end of the array.

methods.name: Function **Sort**(object As Base, comparisonFunction As String) As Boolean
methods.description: Sorts the array. *comparisonFunction* must be the name of a user-defined comparison function that takes two arguments of type *Type* and returns an integer. The return value must be -1 if the the first arguement is smaller than the second, 1 if the first argument is greater than the second, and 0 if the arguments are equal. *object* is the this pointer passed to the comparison function. It may be *null* if the camparison function does not access any member variables. The comparison function must be defined in the same script as the *Type* (if it is a structure) or in the script where *Sort* is called.

methods.description: Creates a texture object by name, e.g. "IMAGE*ImageName"

methods.name: Function **CreateTextureBGL**(name As String) As Integer
methods.description: Creates a texture object by name using background loading, e.g. "IMAGE*ImageName"

methods.name: Sub **Delete**()
methods.description: Deletes the container.

methods.name: Sub **DeleteAlpha**()
methods.description: Deletes the alpha object.

methods.name: Sub **DeleteChildren**()
methods.description: Deletes the container's child containers.

methods.name: Sub **DeleteFunction**(location As String)
methods.description: Deletes a plugin instance by name, e.g. "Autofollow"

methods.name: Function **FindChannelOfObject**(channelName As String) As Channel
methods.description:
*(Inherited from Base)* Finds an animation channel acting on this object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it returns *null*.
You can limit the search to a particular director by using the syntax "directorName$channelName" for the *channelName* argument. Nested directors may be specified like this: "directorName1$directorName2$channelName".

methods.name: Function **FindKeyframeOfObject**(keyframeName As String) As Keyframe
methods.description:
*(Inherited from Base)* Finds a keyframe acting on the object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it returns *null*.
You can limit the search to a particular director by using the syntax "directorName$keyframeName" for the *keyframeName* argument. Nested directors may be specified like this: "directorName1$directorName2$keyframeName".

methods.name: Function **FindOrCreateChannelOfObject**(channelName As String) As Channel
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* This function works like FindChannelOfObject except that if no animation channel with the specifed name exists, a new one is created.

methods.name: Function **FindSiblingSubContainer**(name As String) As Container
methods.description: Searches among the container's siblings (as well as the container itself) and their sub-containers for a container with the specified name. Otherwise identical to FindSubContainer.

methods.name: Function **FindSubContainer**(name As String) As Container
methods.description: Searches for a sub-container with the specified name. The search mode is breadth-first. It's possible to combine multiple calls to this function into one call by concatenating the individual container names using $ as a separator. For example, FindSubContainer("name1$name2") has the same effect as FindSubContainer("name1").FindSubContainer("name2").

methods.name: Function **FindSuperContainer**(name As String) As Container
methods.description: Searches for a super-container with the specified name.

methods.name: Sub **GetBoundingBox**(v1_out As Vertex, v2_out As Vertex)
methods.description: Returns in *v1_out* and *v2_out* the left-bottom-back and right-top-front vertices of the container's bounding box.

methods.name: Function **GetBoundingBoxDimensions**() As Vertex
methods.description: Returns the dimensions (width, height, depth) of the container's bounding box. (The used bounding box was calculated in the last frame.)

methods.name: Function **GetChannelsOfObject**([out] v As Array[Channel]) As Integer
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Fills the array *v* with the animation channels acting on this object, returning the number of channels. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), *v* will be empty.

methods.name: Function **GetChildContainerByIndex**(index As Integer) As Container
methods.description: Returns the child container specified by *index*.

methods.name: Function **GetChildContainerContainingMouseCursor**() As Container
methods.description: Returns the first child container containing the mouse cursor.

methods.name: Sub **GetContainerAndSubContainers**([out] v As Array[Container], traverseMergedGeometries As Boolean)
Function **GetDirector**() As Director
methods.description: Finds the first director containing an animation of this container.

methods.name: Function **GetDirectorOfMergedGeometry**() As Director
methods.description: If this container holds a merged geometry with an embedded animation, this function returns the corresponding director.

methods.name: Function **GetFirstActiveChildContainer**() As Container
methods.description: Returns the first (=topmost) active child container.

methods.name: Function **GetFunctionPluginInstance**(pluginName As String) As PluginInstance
methods.description: Provides access to the parameters of a function plugin residing on the container.

methods.name: Function **GetFunctionPluginInstances**([out] v As Array[PluginInstance]) As Integer
methods.description: Fills the array *v* with all function plugininstances of this container.

methods.name: Function **GetGeometryPluginInstance**() As PluginInstance
methods.description: Provides access to the parameters of a geometry plugin residing on the container.

methods.name: Function **GetIndexOfFirstActiveChildContainer**() As Integer
methods.description: Returns the 0-based index of the first active child container within the container (or -1 if there is no active child).

methods.name: Function **GetLocalIndex**() As Integer
methods.description: Returns the 0-based index of the container within its parent.

methods.name: Sub **GetScreenBounds**(v1_out As Vertex, v2_out As Vertex)
methods.description: Returns in *v1_out* and *v2_out* the left-bottom and right-top screen coordinates defining the rectangle occupied by the container. (The used bounding box was calculated in the last frame.)

methods.name: Sub **GetScreenBoundsProjectOnEditorResolution**(v1_out As Vertex, v2_out As Vertex)
methods.description: Returns in *v1_out* and *v2_out* the left-bottom and right-top screen coordinates defining the rectangle occupied by the container. (The used bounding box was calculated in the last frame.)The bounding box projection is forced against the editor resolution. This makes a difference in case of halfheight rendering.

methods.name: Function **GetScreenPointToGeomSurface**(x As Integer, y As Integer, pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: This procedure calculates the geometry intersection with the projected ray from the specified screen position and returns true on success. The intersection point is returned in world coordinates.

methods.name: Function **GetScreenPositionOrtho**(x As Integer, y As Integer) As Boolean
methods.description: This procedure gets the container's screen position for orthogonal objects.

methods.name: Function **GetScreenSizeOrtho**(x As Integer, y As Integer) As Boolean
methods.description: This procedure gets the container's screen size in the same way as you can do it via GUI in the Transformation Editor. There can't be any rotation on the object.

methods.name: Function **GetShaderPluginInstance**() As PluginInstance
methods.description: Provides access to the parameters of a shader plugin residing on the container.

methods.name: Sub **GetTransformedBoundingBox**(v1_out As Vertex, v2_out As Vertex)
methods.description: Returns in *v1_out* and *v2_out* the left-bottom-back and right-top-front vertices of the container's bounding box with applied transformation matrix.

methods.name: Function **GetTransformedBoundingBoxDimensions**() As Vertex
methods.description: Returns the dimensions (width, height, depth) of the container's bounding box with applied transformation matrix. (The used bounding box was calculated in the last frame.)

methods.name: Function **GetUVCoordinatesOfScreenPoint**(x As Integer, y As Integer) As Vertex
methods.description: Transforms *(x, y)* into *(u, v)* coordinates that are relative to the x/y cross section of the container's bounding box. The *(u, v)* coordinates are returned in the x and y components of the returned vertex (the z coordinate is always 0.0). If *(x, y)* are within the bounding-box area, *u* and *v* will be within the range [0.0, 1.0].

methods.name: Sub **HideAllChildContainers**()
methods.description: Makes all child containers invisible.

methods.name: Function **IsAnimated**() As Boolean
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Returns true if there are animation channels for this object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it always returns *false*.

methods.name: Function **IsOnTop**() As Boolean
methods.description: Returns true if and only if the container is on top at the mouse cursor position. For this procedure to work correctly, it is required that at least one enter or leave callback be defined on the container or on a super-container.

methods.name: Function **IsScreenPointInBoundingBox**(x As Integer, y As Integer) As Boolean
methods.description: Returns true if the screen point *(x, y)* is inside the area covered by the container's bounding box. (The used bounding box was calculated in the last frame.)

methods.name: Function **IsVertexInBoundingBox**(v As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Returns true if *v* (which must be specified in world coordinates) is inside the container's bounding box. (The used bounding box was calculated in the last frame.)

methods.name: Sub **LocalPosToScreenPos**(pos As Vertex, [out] dX As Double, [out] dY As Double)
methods.description: Converts local position to the position on the screen.

methods.name: Function **LocalPosToWorldPos**(pos As Vertex) As Vertex
methods.description: Converts the local position to a world coordinate space position.

methods.name: Sub **MoveAllChannelsToDirector**(director As Director)
methods.description: Moves the animation channels to the specified director.

methods.name: Sub **MoveAllChannelsToDirector**(dest As Director, root As Director)
methods.description: Moves the animation channels to the specified director and rebuilds the director hierarchy starting from the specified ancestor.

methods.name: Function **MoveTo**(destination As Container, where As Integer) As Container
methods.description:
Moves the container; where =
TL_NEXT
TL_PREVIOUS
TL_DOWN.

methods.name: Function **MoveToKeepTransformation**(destination As Container, where As Integer) As Container
methods.description:
Moves the container preserving the containers transformation; where =
TL_NEXT
TL_PREVIOUS
TL_DOWN.

methods.name: Sub **RecomputeMatrix**()
methods.description: Recalculate transformation matrix of the container. This function is useful if you can't wait one field for the updated matrix. Use it carefully and only where it is really needed (current transformation matrix, transformed bounding box, screen-position or screen-size)

methods.name: Function **ScreenAbsoluteOffsetToLocalPlaneXYOffset**(dXOld As Double, dYOld As Double, dXNew As Double, dYNew As Double, [out] pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Converts the screen offset to a offset on the local object plane. This would mean if you add the returned vertex to the local container's position then it moves exactly to the passed screenposition (on the object plane). With the ability to define start- and stoppoint you can do accurate movements of non-orthogonal objects as well (in contrary to *ScreenOffsetToLocalPlaneXYOffset*). The function returns true on success.

methods.name: Function **ScreenAbsoluteOffsetToLocalPlaneXZOffset**(dXOld As Double, dYOld As Double, dXNew As Double, dYNew As Double, [out] pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Same as *ScreenOffsetToLocalPlaneXYOffset* but on the XZ plane.

methods.name: Function **ScreenAbsoluteOffsetToLocalPlaneYZOffset**(dXOld As Double, dYOld As Double, dXNew As Double, dYNew As Double, [out] pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Same as *ScreenOffsetToLocalPlaneXYOffset* but on the YZ plane.

methods.name: Function **ScreenOffsetToContainerOffset**(dx As Integer, dy As Integer) As Vertex
methods.description: Transforms a pixel offset into the corresponding offset in local container coordinates. In other words, the vector returned by this procedure is the vector you need to add to the container's local position (i.e. *Position.Xyz*) in order to make the container move *(dx, dy)* pixels on the screen.

methods.name: Function **ScreenOffsetToLocalPlaneXYOffset**(dX As Double, dY As Double, [out] pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Converts the screen offset to a offset on the local object plane. This would mean if you add the returned vertex to the local container's position then it moves exactly to the passed screenposition (on the object plane). The function returns true on success.

methods.name: Function **ScreenOffsetToLocalPlaneXZOffset**(dX As Double, dY As Double, [out] pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Same as *ScreenOffsetToLocalPlaneXYOffset* but on the XZ plane.

methods.name: Function **ScreenOffsetToLocalPlaneYZOffset**(dX As Double, dY As Double, [out] pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Same as *ScreenOffsetToLocalPlaneXYOffset* but on the YZ plane.

methods.name: Function **ScreenPosToLocalGrid**(dX As Double, dY As Double) As Vertex
methods.description: Converts the screen position to current grid intersection point. The returned coordinates are in local container coordinate space.

methods.name: Function **ScreenPosToLocalPlaneXY**(dX As Double, dY As Double, [out] pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Converts the screen position to a position on the local object plane. This would mean if you assign the returned vertex to the local container's position then it moves exactly to the passed screenposition (on the object plane). The function returns true on success.

methods.name: Function **ScreenPosToLocalPlaneXZ**(dX As Double, dY As Double, [out] pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Same as *ScreenPosToLocalPlaneXY* but on the XZ plane.

methods.name: Function **ScreenPosToLocalPlaneYZ**(dX As Double, dY As Double, [out] pos As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: Same as *ScreenPosToLocalPlaneXY* but on the YZ plane.

methods.name: Function **ScreenPosToLocalPos**(dX As Double, dY As Double) As Vertex
methods.description: Converts the screen position to the local container position. This would mean that if you assign the returned vertex to the local container's position then it moves exactly to the passed screen position (orthogonal to camera).

methods.name: Sub **SetCenterPositionLocked**(center As Vertex)
methods.description: This procedure sets the container's center point without affecting its position.

methods.name: Sub **SetCenterScreenGridPositionLocked**(dX As Double, dY As Double)
methods.description: This procedure sets the container's center point to the passed screen position, using the current grid, without affecting the container position.

methods.name: Sub **SetCenterScreenPositionLocked**(dX As Double, dY As Double)
methods.description: This procedure sets the container's center point to the passed screen position without affecting the container position.

methods.name: Sub **SetChanged**()
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Mark this object as changed.

methods.name: Function **SetScreenPositionOrtho**(x As Integer, y As Integer) As Boolean
methods.description: This procedure sets the container's screen position for orthogonal objects.

methods.name: Function **SetScreenSizeOrtho**(x As Integer, y As Integer) As Boolean
methods.description: This procedure sets the container's screen size in the same way as you can do it via GUI in the Transformation Editor.

methods.name: Sub **ShowAllChildContainers**()
methods.description: Makes all child containers visible.

methods.name: Sub **ShowOneChildContainer**(index As Integer)
methods.description: Makes the child container specified by *index* visible and all other child containers invisible.

methods.name: Sub **Update**()
methods.description: Redraws the container's entry in the scene tree GUI. Ignored in on-air mode.

methods.name: Function **WorldPosToLocalPos**(pos As Vertex) As Vertex
methods.description: Converts the world position to a local coordinate space position.

methods.name: Function **ScreenOffsetToWorldOffset**(dx As Integer, dy As Integer) As Vertex
methods.description: Deprecated.

Types.name: DateTime
Types.descripton: A type storing date/time information.

properties.name: **DayOfMonth** As Integer
properties.description: Day of month (1-31)

properties.name: **DayOfWeek** As Integer
properties.description: Day of week (0-6; Sunday = 0)

properties.name: **DayOfYear** As Integer
properties.description: Day of year (0-365)

properties.name: **Hour** As Integer
properties.description: Hours after midnight (0-23)

properties.name: **Minute** As Integer
properties.description: Minutes after hour (0-59)

properties.name: **Month** As Integer
properties.description: Month (1-12)

properties.name: **Second** As Integer
properties.description: Seconds after minute (0-59)

properties.name: **Year** As Integer
properties.description: Year

methods.name: Sub **Normalize**()
methods.description: Computes *DayOfWeek* and *DayOfYear* members and forces the other members to standard ranges.

methods.name: Function **ToString**() As String
methods.description: Returns a date+time string of the form *Wed Jan 02 02:03:55 1980*.

properties.name: **Event** As Integer *[read-only]*

properties.description: Returns the Id of the recognized gesture pattern (PATTERN_INVALID, PATTERN_RIGHT, PATTERN_LEFT, PATTERN_UP, PATTERN_DOWN, PATTERN_CIRCLE, PATTERN_SQUARE, PATTERN_TRIANGLE)

properties.description: Returns the number of traces involved in this gesture.

properties.name: **Valid** As Boolean *[read-only]*
properties.description: Returns true if the object is valid.

properties.name: **xy** As Vertex *[read-only]*
properties.description: Returns the gesture position in screen-coordinates.

properties.description: Returns true if the object is valid.

methods.description: Returns the bezier handle for the specified axis. The *axis* parameter is only used if the keyframe has multiple splines, which is the case for rotation, scaling, and material keyframes. When called on a position keyframe, this procedure returns the handle for the distance spline. To get the path handle, use the *PathHandle* property instead.

Types.name: Matrix
Types.descripton: A 4x4 matrix. The index operator [] can be used to access individual entries, with indices 0, 1, 2, 3 referring to the entries of the first column, 4, 5, 6, 7 to the second, etc.

methods.name: Sub **Frustum**(left As Double, right As Double, bottom As Double, top As Double, near As Double, far As Double)
Function **GetRotationXYZ**(v As Vertex, v2 As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: This function can be used to retrieve the rotations used by a container. The return value is true if two solutions for the x, y and z rotation were found. If the return value is false, the solution is undefined (x rotation is either 90 or 270 degrees).

methods.name: Function **GetRotationZXY**(v As Vertex, v2 As Vertex) As Boolean
methods.description: This function can be used to retrieve the rotations used by a camera. The return value is true if two solutions for the x, y and z rotation were found. If the return value is false, the solution is undefined (x rotation is either 90 or 270 degrees).

methods.name: Function **GetScaling2**() As Vertex
methods.description: Returns the squared scaling factors.

methods.name: Sub **MTRegister**(stroke As Integer, controlType As Integer)
methods.description:
Registers a control for a certain stroke in the multitouch core. Control types:
MT_CONTROL_BUTTON
MT_CONTROL_PZR2D
MT_CONTROL_PZR2D_TILT

methods.name: Sub **MTRegisterEx**(stroke As Integer, controlType As Integer, params As Array[Double])
methods.description:
Same as *MTRegister* but with the additional possibility to set parameters for the specified control. E.g.:
dim params as array[double]
params.push(0) 'lock x
params.push(0) 'lock y
params.push(0) 'lock position
params.push(0) 'lock rotation
params.push(0) 'lock scale
params.push(1) 'momentum
params.push(0.027) 'friction coefficient (here: steel on ice)
scriptplugininstance.MTRegisterEx(stroke, MT_CONTROL_PZR2D, params)

methods.description:
*(Inherited from Base)* Finds an animation channel acting on this object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it returns *null*.
You can limit the search to a particular director by using the syntax "directorName$channelName" for the *channelName* argument. Nested directors may be specified like this: "directorName1$directorName2$channelName".

methods.name: Function **FindContainer**(name As String) As Container
methods.description: Searches the scene tree for a container named *name*. The search mode is breadth-first. It's possible to combine a call to this function and multiple calls to Container.FindSubContainer into a single call by concatenating the individual container names using $ as a separator. For example, scene.FindContainer("name1$name2") has the same effect as scene.FindContainer("name1").FindSubContainer("name2").

Types.name: Script
Types.descripton: The container's script object. This is used to dynamically call member procedures of another container.

Types.name: ScriptSettings
Types.descripton: A script's local settings.

properties.name: **CallButtonDownForTopObjectsOnly** As Boolean
properties.description: If set to true, the OnXButtonDown procedures are called only if the container contains the mouse cursor and is on top at the mouse cursor position. Default = *true*.

properties.name: **CallEnterLeaveForTopObjectsOnly** As Boolean
properties.description: If set to true, OnEnter/OnLeave/OnEnterSubContainer/OnLeaveSubContainer is called only if the container is on top at the mouse cursor position. Default = *true*.

properties.name: **CallMouseMoveForTopObjectsOnly** As Boolean
properties.description: If set to true, OnMouseMove is called only if the container contains the mouse cursor and is on top at the mouse cursor position. Default = *false*.

properties.name: **CallEnterLeaveForBackgroundObjects** As Boolean
properties.description: Deprecated. Use *CallEnterLeaveForTopObjectsOnly* instead.

properties.name: **CallMouseMoveForBackgroundObjects** As Boolean
properties.description: Deprecated. Use *CallMouseMoveForTopObjectsOnly* instead.

Types.name: SharedMemory

A storage object that holds a map of *Variant* objects indexed by a string.
It can be used for system-wide or scene-wide data sharing.

methods.description: Creates a new empty variable.

methods.name: Function **DeleteKey**(key As String) As Boolean
methods.description: Deletes a variable.

methods.name: Function **FindChannelOfObject**(channelName As String) As Channel
methods.description:
*(Inherited from Base)* Finds an animation channel acting on this object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it returns *null*.
You can limit the search to a particular director by using the syntax "directorName$channelName" for the *channelName* argument. Nested directors may be specified like this: "directorName1$directorName2$channelName".

methods.name: Function **FindKeyframeOfObject**(keyframeName As String) As Keyframe
methods.description:
*(Inherited from Base)* Finds a keyframe acting on the object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it returns *null*.
You can limit the search to a particular director by using the syntax "directorName$keyframeName" for the *keyframeName* argument. Nested directors may be specified like this: "directorName1$directorName2$keyframeName".

methods.name: Function **FindOrCreateChannelOfObject**(channelName As String) As Channel
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* This function works like FindChannelOfObject except that if no animation channel with the specifed name exists, a new one is created.

methods.name: Function **GetChannelsOfObject**([out] v As Array[Channel]) As Integer
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Fills the array *v* with the animation channels acting on this object, returning the number of channels. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), *v* will be empty.

methods.name: Sub **GetKeys**(keys As Array[String])
methods.description: Fills the passed array with all defined keys.

methods.name: Function **IsAnimated**() As Boolean
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Returns true if there are animation channels for this object. If this function is called on a type that cannot be animated (such as *Director*), it always returns *false*.

methods.name: Function **LoadFromDb**(path As String) As Boolean
methods.description: Loads the contents of the map from a database file. The file is specified by *path*, which must be an absolute path, such as "/User/mem_map".

methods.name: Function **LoadFromDbAsync**(path As String) As Boolean
methods.description: Loads the contents of the map from a database file. The file is specified by *path*, which must be an absolute path, such as "/User/mem_map". This function is called asynchronous, so the value does not have to be loaded when the function returns.

methods.name: Sub **RegisterChangedCallback**(key As String)
methods.description: Causes *OnSharedMemoryVariableChanged* to be invoked whenever the variable identified by *key* is changed and *OnSharedMemoryVariableDeleted* in response to the key being deleted. If you pass an empty string for *key*, the callbacks will be invoked whenever *any* variable in the map is changed or deleted.

methods.name: Function **SaveToDb**(path As String) As Boolean
methods.description: Saves the contents of the map into a database file. The file is specified by *path*, which must be an absolute path, such as "/User/mem_map". Attention: If you are calling this function with a high frequency (e.g.: in *OnExecPerField*) then this can result in slow rendering and incomplete GH replications!

methods.name: Function **SaveToDbAsync**(path As String) As Boolean
methods.description: Saves the contents of the map into a database file. The file is specified by *path*, which must be an absolute path, such as "/User/mem_map". This function is called asynchronous, so the value does not have to be stored when the function returns.Attention: asynchronous call

methods.name: Sub **SetChanged**()
methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Mark this object as changed.

methods.name: Function **SetValueDelayed**(key As String, value As Variant) As Boolean
methods.description: Sets value via the corresponding transport mechanism (e.g. GraphicHub). This prevents possible re-triggering of the OnSharedMemoryVariableChanged callback.

methods.name: Sub **UnregisterChangedCallback**(key As String)
methods.description: Removes the binding set up by *RegisterChangedCallback*.

Types.name: String
Types.descripton: A character string. Use the '&' operator to concatenate strings.

properties.name: **Length** As Integer *[read-only]*
properties.description:
Gets the length of the string.
Checking the length of a doublebyte string:
You have to make sure to use the correct function for calculating double byte strings. Normal Doublebyte Fonts (Asian/Cyrillic) are calculated wrong if you use the string.length() function.
Solution: To get the prober length, you have to convert it using Utf8ToAnsi()

methods.name: Sub **AnsiToUtf8**()
methods.description: Converts an ANSI encoded string (using the system code-page) to UTF-8.

methods.name: Sub **Append**(str As String)
methods.description: Appends 'str' to the string

methods.name: Function **EndsWith**(str As String) As Boolean
methods.description: Returns true if the string ends with 'str'

methods.name: Sub **Erase**(pos As Integer, len As Integer)
methods.description: Erases a range of 'len' characters starting at 'pos'

methods.name: Sub **EraseChar**(pos As Integer)
methods.description: Erases the string, starting at 'pos'

methods.name: Function **Find**(substring As String) As Integer
methods.description: Searches for a substring

methods.name: Function **FindFirstNotOf**(chars As String) As Integer
methods.description: Searches for the first character that is not equal to any character within 'chars'

methods.name: Function **FindFirstOf**(chars As String) As Integer
methods.description: Searches for the first character that is equal to any character within 'chars'

methods.name: Function **FindLastNotOf**(chars As String) As Integer
methods.description: Searches for the last character that is not equal to any character within 'chars'

methods.name: Function **FindLastOf**(chars As String) As Integer
methods.description: Searches for the last character that is equal to any character within 'chars'

methods.name: Function **GetChar**(pos As Integer) As String
methods.description: Returns the character at 'pos'

methods.name: Function **GetSubstring**(pos As Integer, len As Integer) As String
methods.description: Returns a substring

methods.name: Sub **Insert**(pos As Integer, str As String)
methods.description: Inserts 'str' before position 'pos'

methods.name: Sub **Join**(strings As Array[String], joiner As String)
methods.description: Concatenates individual strings

methods.name: Function **Left**(len As Integer) As String
methods.description: Extracts 'len' characters from the left end of the string

methods.name: Sub **MakeLower**()
methods.description: Converts the string to an lower-case string

methods.name: Sub **MakeUpper**()
methods.description: Converts the string to an upper-case string

methods.name: Function **Match**(regex As String) As Boolean
methods.description: Returns true if the regular expression 'regex' is found int the string

methods.name: Sub **PadLeft**(totalWidth As Integer, paddingChar As String)
methods.description: Right-aligns the characters of the string

methods.name: Sub **PadRight**(totalWidth As Integer, paddingChar As String)
methods.description: Left-aligns the characters of the string

methods.name: Sub **Prepend**(str As String)
methods.description: Inserts 'str' at the beginning of the string

methods.name: Sub **Replace**(pos As Integer, len As Integer, str As String)
methods.description: Replaces the substring specified by 'pos' and 'len' with 'str'

methods.name: Sub **ReplaceChar**(pos As Integer, str As String)
methods.description: Replaces the character at 'pos' with 'str'

methods.name: Function **RFind**(substring As String) As Integer
methods.description: Searches backward for a substring

methods.name: Function **Right**(len As Integer) As String
methods.description: Extracts 'len' characters from the right end of the string

methods.name: Sub **Split**(separators As String, [out] result As Array[String])
methods.description:
Splits a string into substrings; if 'separators' is empty, whitespace sequences act as separators. Example:
dim a as string = "Monday Thuesday Wednesday"
dim b as array[string]
a.split(" ",b)
b will be ["Monday","Thuesday","Wednesday"]

methods.name: Function **StartsWith**(str As String) As Boolean
methods.description: Returns true if the string starts with 'str'

methods.name: Function **Substitute**(regex As String, subst As String, global As Boolean) As Integer
methods.description: Replaces 'regex' with 'subst'. If 'global' is true, all occurences of 'regex' are replaced. Otherwise, only the first occurrece is replaced.

methods.name: Sub **TclSplit**([out] result As Array[String])
methods.description: Splits a string TCL-style-wise, using whitespace as separators (TCL-style means: Braced and double-quoted strings are never split even if they contain whitespace).

methods.name: Sub **Trim**()
methods.description: Removes whitspace characters from both ends of the string

methods.name: Sub **URLDecode**()
methods.description: Decodes a URL as string.

methods.name: Sub **URLEncode**()
methods.description: Encodes a string as URL.

methods.name: Sub **Utf8ToAnsi**()
methods.description: Converts a UTF-8 encoded string to ANSI (using the system code-page).

methods.name: Function **SendRemoteCommand**(hostname As String, port As Integer, commandString As String, timeoutInMs As Integer) As String
methods.description:
Sends a command string to a viz engine running on another PC.
If *timeoutInMs* > 0, the procedure waits at most *timeoutInMs* milliseconds for an answer, and susequently returns that answer.
If *timeoutInMs* = 0, the procedure returns immediatly, ignoring any answer.

methods.description: *(Inherited from Base)* Mark this object as changed.

methods.description: Launches an application. If *activate* is false, the application window is minimized.

methods.description: Stops sound playback. See *PlaySound*.

methods.name: Function **TcpSend**(hostname As String, port As Integer, commandString As String, timeoutInMs As Integer) As String
methods.description:
Sends a command string via TCP/IP to a remote socket. Unlike *SendRemoteCommand*, this procedure sends the command string as is, that is without a viz command identifier attached.
The *timeoutInMs* has the same meaning as for *SendRemoteCommand*.

methods.name: Sub **TcpSendAsync**(sharedMemoryKey As String, hostname As String, port As Integer, commandString As String, timeoutInMs As Integer)
methods.description:
Sends a command string via TCP/IP to a remote socket. Unlike *TcpSend*, this procedure works asynchron and the return result is stored in a shared memory map, at your defined *sharedMemoryKey*.
The defined *sharedMemoryKey* or its RegisterChangedCallback will be searched in the maps in the following order: *Scene.Map*, *System.Map* and *VizCommunication.Map*
If *timeoutInMs* is set to 0 then *TcpSendAsync* will wait until a answer is received or as long as no error occurs (e.g. host doesn't exist).

methods.name: Sub **TcpSendAsyncStatus**(sharedMemoryKey As String, hostname As String, port As Integer, commandString As String, timeoutInMs As Integer, sharedMemoryKeyStatus As String)
methods.description:
Same as *TcpSendAsync* but with additional status Shared Memory Key which informs you about the transmission process. The following Messages (Strings) will be returned in *sharedMemoryKeyStatus*:
*SENDING*
*RECEIVED*
*ERROR*
*TIMEOUT*
The *timeoutInMs* has the same meaning as for *TcpSendAsync*.
